document.title: Information Technology Career Field Technical Content Standards

304EA75B615042388F52E778C2080EF8.description: Establish a process for archiving files.

DCC2A968DA944266B63C18C9935EF159.description: Identify the criteria for selecting a backup system.

929C92E1CC8447E8AB7B5AAE4D549DCF.description: Differentiate between disaster recovery and business continuity.

548B27F1BA0247BA8F1BE3FEC89AAAEE.description: Disaster Recovery: Recommend disaster recovery and business continuity plans.

50C82D4A7A29407EAD7E6D948DEEB04A.description: Assemble and test Ethernet cable (e.g., straight-through, crossover, loopback).

9D6800F2B07C4BCDB1A68196B6D77E21.description: Describe typical problems associated with cable installation.

5159239408464B978FECA807A7FBC445.description: Identify the advantages and disadvantages of cabling systems.

AF3FBBEBCB1B46479BDFF2B9BDBE4386.description: Identify media standards (e.g., American National Standards Institute [ANSI], Electronic Industries Alliance/Telecommunications Industry Association [EIA/TIA]-568, EIA/TIA-568A and 568B).

0150E9A1795042EE9B75A2ECF87524C2.description: Describe types of media connectors (e.g., Bayonet Neill-Concelman [BNC], Registered Jack [RJ]-45, LC, ST) and grounding techniques.

D40E9C678D424B9E972108146D761EFE.description: Compare media categories (e.g., single mode, multimode, CAT5, CAT5E, CAT6+).

FA6A295C988A434CA79EA626AE9D2E85.description: Differentiate between media types (e.g., coaxial, twisted pair, fiber optic) and interfaces.

8A51973946E94372BCAD1BB3A4F268FD.description: Identify the criteria used in selecting media (e.g., physical properties, transmission technologies, transmission span, bandwidth, topology, security, noise immunity, installation considerations, cost).

46AD822632044A16860029C128A5418D.description: Network Media: Select, assemble, terminate, and test media.

48A20C771C7549248DB967D157A22FC6.description: Learners apply principles of networking and infrastructure related to the installation, administration, and maintenance of computer networks and components. Knowledge and skills may be applied to network connectivity, cabling, protocols, architecture, classification, topologies, operating systems, Open Systems Interconnection (OSI) standards, data encoding, Quality of Service (QoS), Internet Protocol (IP) addressing, and wide area network (WAN) design.

864939D2B0444D6DAD6840316FCE2EB5.description: Test delivered application to assure that it is fully functional for the customer or user and meets all requirements.

CFC6E69FBF374052B09CBEF7CCB28E25.description: Identify support staff, training needs, and contingency plans in the rollout plan.

69EB3ED874AA46DBA8A4654A61517066.description: Conduct final review and approvals according to company standards.

2E129B125AB54413900F154DE5A2D51E.description: Communicate rollout plans to key stakeholders in a timely manner.

8F991DB9CB1543B496EEAEFD420DEF1B.description: Include overall project goals and timelines in the rollout plan.

1F1370556ED9475ABC000C8D9E6371D9.description:
Rollout and Handoff
Plan: Rollout and facilitate handoff to customer

753119ABB6B3462783457FD71A02CBCE.description: Seek stakeholder acceptance upon successful completion of the test plan.

B053D5A52FC743BEA7703DF1614E9E9B.description: Make corrections indicated by test results.

2D42DFD62F3B4F3A8A90968BE5971B12.description: Develop, perform, and document usability and testing integration.

B012F93A05D640BFB02CE47A167546FD.description: Develop test cases that are realistic, compare with expected performance, and include targeted platforms and device types.

6093717DFCC3490F88F6EDA01E115490.description: Develop a test system that accurately mimics external interfaces.

B6493DD081F549138955A743E62D94F3.description: Create a written procedure agreed by the stakeholders and project team for determining the acceptability of the project deliverables.

9F6163E609B64C779AB2471428D3E87F.description: Performance Tests and Acceptance Plans: Develop performance tests and acceptance plans.

C0EA80E540A24496985C8016FCECF804.description: Document the problem and the verified solution.

BB4727246B224FD8B09F83AFD70CC4D9.description: Gather and analyze data about the problem.

319D45696A9B49BCB0B554601362BA7D.description: Investigate symptoms based on the selected methodology.

BC6342365B6649BBB46EF9D164F844BA.description: Select troubleshooting methodology (e.g., top down, bottom up, follow the path, spot the differences).

9E7703B1C37B40599B3FDD37CEBB5E6F.description: Troubleshooting: Select and apply troubleshooting methodologies for problem solving.

A413B88EF4C0440C84EA511768910DCF.description: Backup, restore, test, archive, and manage data.

E830A516DE0E49399ED822D158AB0291.description: Backup, restore, test, archive, and manage data.

12DCE612F9F74E77A399CFDE8974048C.description: Backup, restore, test, archive, and manage data.

F18C5BC8CC1A4E7A8CF0433843D9620D.description: Monitor equipment operation and troubleshoot issues and problems.

75FEB62673A343F988023E2BA6678594.description: Prepare and operate equipment per project design specifications.

D445024A7214488DA11C07DD5B7CBBF7.description: Identify processor, memory, storage, power and environmental requirements.

7EAAC8C1B53B4EEBACCF062A79336FB2.description: Identify hardware platforms, configurations, and support models.

25CAC6EB452B453886ABA4804D032981.description: Equipment: Select, operate, and maintain equipment.

D57D7482D8AF4A7ABB72D0EE9AF769E6.description: Document installation, configuration, and compatibility of hardware and software.

F85EE3BB64B54D1B9AACE6C05ECB657F.description: Determine compatibility of software and hardware and resolve any conflicts

25CAFB21F2994D868B969A85CA881B60.description: Preserve, convert, or migrate existing data files to a new format.

6564D5E78A4347FB8FD8F5F4C3F2CB4A.description: Install and test new software and software upgrades on stand-alone, mobile, and networked systems.

FDF449F190624E678FCED2BE8D67C35B.description: Verify software compatibility and troubleshoot any software incompatibility.

12D01A744FFA4F7A982F829616855938.description: Identify hardware requirements for software applications.

1D9EF8A58E734EFB96516EB781ADEF84.description: Comply with license agreements for software and hardware and describe the consequences of noncompliance

3D7C4A3527824CC9B4E953B00F8A002B.description: Installation and Configuration: Install and configure hardware and software.

69B2D7F9ECDA46A1A70363CF49CEF5D2.description: Describe emerging technologies (e.g., Bring your Own Device [BYOD], Services Virtualization, Augmented Reality [AR], SMART Devices, Additive Manufacturing [3D Printing]).

1C2FDE6656A04DAEA8258BE5FBCFBB79.description: Utilize cloud computing applications (e.g., services, applications, virtual        environments).

D5DE031C5C784ACD97935FAF729C7C11.description:
Describe the differences, advantages, and limitations of cloud computing (e.g.,
public cloud, private cloud, hybrid cloud) and on‐premises computing.

F2312D8E9D2F45249718A0214A9DA6B0.description: Investigate the scope and the impact of mobile computing environments on society.

32D8A27FEE944CEBA9CE6B4EF81CE991.description:
Emerging Technologies: Identify trending technologies, their fundamental architecture, and their value in the
marketplace.

5FFBBB8F5A7445549B79C0778195F947.description: Describe the characteristics and uses of networks, network devices, and components (e.g., hubs, switches, routers, firewalls).

42A62937227E42FF83B51A8AD7890AEE.description: Differentiate between cable types (e.g., fiber optic, twisted pair, coaxial) and interfaces.

6039D22817D44428A3F8E183738847CE.description: Identify and apply Transmission Control Protocol and Internet Protocol (TCP/IP), Internet Protocol Version 4 (IPv4), Internet Protocol Version 6 (IPv6) applications and services (e.g., rlogin, Simple Mail Transfer Protocol [SMTP], Telecommunications Network [Telnet], File Transfer Protocol [FTP], Domain Name System [DNS], Network File System [NFS], Voice over Internet Protocol [VoIP], Internet Control Message Protocol [ICMP]).

9A4BB36B211347CFA9B860633342FA0F.description: Differentiate between the Internet, intranets, and extranets.

520A0D4181DA4EABA3718C3B681F18A5.description: Select network storage techniques (e.g., fiber channel, Internet Small Computer System Interface [iSCSI], Fiber Channel over Ethernet [FCoE], Serial Attached SCSI [SAS], Network File Systems [NFS], Network Attached Storage/Server Message Blocks [NAS/SMB])

20846D8DE32549D4853F7512CB06824B.description: Select the basic point-to-point (PTP) and point-to-multipoint (PTMP) network topologies (e.g., star, ring, tree, network, mesh, irregular) and broadband and baseband transmission methods.

4BDCDEA008284B59ACDA5AB93D7CFB8F.description: Differentiate between Local Area Networks (LANs), Wide Area Networks (WANs), Wireless Local Area Networks (WLANs), and Near Field Communication (NFC).

FDF33DFE4F114CFCA5138AB167DB18E9.description: Networking Fundamentals:  Apply networking fundamentals to infrastructure systems.

7D0339BF234D46A1BD2ABE5D0C3379D0.description: Describe privacy security compliance on systems (e.g., Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act [HIPAA], Payment Card Industry [PCI], Sarbanes Oxley Act [SOX], Americans with Disabilities Act [ADA], General Data Protection Regulation [GDPR], European Union Data Protection Regulation [EUDPR]).

98123A78C62A43C6B857BE37BA6EBD99.description: Practice information security per job requirements.

1E83CB946E48400A8CCB8B1ABF1A1FC6.description: Identify the need for personal security in digital information and describe how personal information can be safeguarded.

7EE7140CD2534441AF68C10844F29662.description: Describe computer forensics, its importance in information security and cybersecurity, and its relevance to law enforcement.

C82FC3A0C6F74178A0BCC4848E25D0FF.description: Describe the need for security in application development.

15873194C9874EC29D3607F074186767.description: Describe the need for security in networking (e.g., firewall, access controls, encryption, demilitarized zone).

5A9C0BBDF8FD4CDF83071AB6039A452C.description: Describe the components of the physical environment (e.g., wiring closets, server rooms) and physical security systems.

19688EA1CE814C73934439769A5623F3.description: Describe major threats to computer systems (e.g., insider threats, viruses, worms, spyware, ransomware, spoofing, hacking, social engineering, phishing).

833E02B808254C95B9EA3FE8726FB4B7.description: Identify security risks and describe associated safeguards and methodologies (e.g., auditing).

38045A61CA0146EB93B3BA202A0F2902.description: Explain the need for confidentiality, integrity, and availability (CIA) of information.

C4D517E1F78942D4AEA44ABB33BDCEF7.description: Security, Risks, and Safeguards: Describe the need for security and explain security risks and security safeguards.

658322DA4A1943A5ACAD9D728C85AD12.description: Learners apply fundamental principles of IT, including the history of IT and its impact on society, common industry terms, systems theory, information storage and retrieval, database management, and computer hardware, software, and peripheral device configuration and installation. This base of knowledge and skills may be applied across the career field
